paper: ECO_ Enhanced Code Optimization via Performance-Aware Prompting for Code-LLMs

differences.summary: Clarity score lowered due to added internal inconsistencies
differences.why_impacts_score: More documented inconsistencies reduce readability and reproducibility

evidence.baseline_quote: Clarity (10): 7 — Generally clear … but some reporting gaps.
evidence.final_quote: Clarity (10): 6 — … internal inconsistencies and reporting gaps … reduce readability and reproducibility.

differences.why_impacts_score: Undermines trust in headline results and internal consistency

evidence.final_quote: Introduction attributes 7.81× to GPT‑4o‑mini, but Table 4 shows 7.81× for GPT‑o4‑mini.
Figure 1 marks “O(n²) computation” for a single-loop implementation that is O(n).

differences.summary: Embedding model specification mismatch across Sections/Appendix

evidence.baseline_quote: Prompts and configurations … are described … aiding reproducibility.

differences.summary: Decoding parameter inconsistency for closed-source models
differences.why_impacts_score: Inconsistent generation settings threaten fair comparison

evidence.baseline_quote: best@k … number of candidates … not fully specified.
evidence.final_quote: Section 4.1.1 states temperature 0.7, Appendix B says “default decoding parameters”.

differences.summary: Non‑standard VLA directive under C++17 compile setting
differences.why_impacts_score: Potential compilation issues weaken directive validity

evidence.baseline_quote: Concrete directive examples … (Figs. 6–9) illustrate actionable prompts.
evidence.final_quote: A directive suggests VLAs “int v[n];” under C++17 -O3; GNU extensions not clarified.

differences.summary: ROI category labeling inconsistency (e.g., cout→printf labeled Algorithm)
differences.why_impacts_score: Mislabeling reduces coherence of the knowledge base

evidence.baseline_quote: We manually cluster similar ROIs … lacks detail … impacts reproducibility.
evidence.final_quote: JSON labels “cout→printf” as “Algorithm” while text defines “Library Usage” categories.

differences.summary: Ambiguous phrasing about compiler optimizations vs -O3 baseline

evidence.baseline_quote: GCC -O3 baseline is reported to isolate improvements beyond compiler optimization.
evidence.final_quote: “exclude compiler-level optimizations” while compiling with -O3; should be clarified.
